sentences.text: NOTICE OF ANNUAL MEETING OF SHAREHOLDERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notice is hereby given that a meeting of the Shareholders of Whole Foods Market, Inc. will be held at the JW Marriott Austin, 110 E. 2nd Street, Austin, Texas 78701, on February 17, 2017 at 8:00 a.m. local time for the following purposes:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. To elect the 12 nominees named in the attached Proxy Statement to the Board of Directors of Whole Foods Market, Inc. to serve one-year terms expiring at the later of the Annual Meeting of Shareholders in 2018 or upon a successor being elected and qualified;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. To conduct an advisory vote to approve the compensation of the named executive officers;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. To conduct an advisory vote on the frequency of shareholder votes on executive compensation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. To ratify the appointment of Ernst & Young LLP as independent auditor for the fiscal year ending September 24, 2017;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5. To consider two shareholder proposals, described in the accompanying Proxy Statement, if properly presented at the Annual Meeting of Shareholders; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6. To transact such other business as may properly come before the meeting or any adjournments or postponements thereof.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Only shareholders of record at the close of business on December 21, 2016 are entitled to notice of, and to vote at, the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All shareholders are requested to be present in person or by proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any shareholder who later finds that he or she can be present at the meeting, or for any reason desires to do so, may revoke the proxy at any time before it is voted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Important Notice Regarding the Availability of Proxy Materials for the 2017 Annual Shareholders Meeting: We are mailing to many of our shareholders a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials (which we refer to as a Notice), rather than mailing a full paper set of the materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Notice contains instructions on how to access our proxy materials on the Internet, as well as instructions on obtaining a paper copy of the proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This process is more environmentally friendly and reduces our costs to print and distribute these materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All shareholders who do not receive such a Notice, including shareholders who have previously requested to receive a paper copy of the materials, will receive a full set of paper proxy materials by U.S. mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting by the Internet or telephone is fast and convenient, and your vote is immediately confirmed and tabulated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you receive a paper copy of the proxy materials, you may also vote by completing, signing, dating and returning the accompanying proxy card in the enclosed return envelope furnished for that purpose.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By using the Internet or telephone, you help us reduce postage and proxy tabulation costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please do not return the enclosed paper ballot if you are voting over the Internet or by telephone.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Record Date: December 21, 2016
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By Order of the Board of Directors,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: January 4, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: YOUR VOTE IS IMPORTANT!
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether or not you plan to attend the meeting, please cast your vote as promptly as possible by Internet, telephone or U.S. mail.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Meeting of Shareholders of the Company to be held on February 17, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Questions and Answers Regarding This Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: Why am I being asked to review these materials?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A:     The accompanying proxy is solicited on behalf of the Board of Directors of Whole Foods Market, Inc., a Texas corporation (which we refer to as the Company, we, us or our).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are providing these proxy materials to you in connection with our Annual Meeting of Shareholders to be held at the JW Marriott Austin, 110 E. 2nd Street, Austin, Texas 78701, on February 17, 2017 at 8:00 a.m. local time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a Company shareholder, you are invited to attend the Annual Meeting and are entitled and encouraged to vote on the proposals described in this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: Why am I being asked to review materials online?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: Under rules adopted by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, we are furnishing proxy materials to many of our shareholders on the Internet rather than mailing printed copies of those materials to each shareholder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you received a Notice by mail, you will not receive a printed copy of the proxy materials unless you request one.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instead, the Notice will instruct you as to how you may access and review the proxy materials on the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you received a Notice and would like to receive a printed copy of our proxy materials, please follow the instructions included in the Notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We anticipate the Notice will be mailed to shareholders on or about January 4, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: Who may vote at the meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: You may vote all of the shares of our common stock that you owned at the close of business on December 21, 2016, the record date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On the record date, the Company had 318,490,727 shares of common stock outstanding and entitled to vote at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may cast one vote for each share of common stock held by you on each of the matters presented at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: What proposals will be voted on at the meeting and how does the Board of Directors recommend I vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: There are six proposals to be considered and voted on at the meeting, including four Company proposals and two shareholder proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please see the information included in the Proxy Statement relating to these proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proposals to be voted on and related recommendations from the Board of Directors are as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company Proposals
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. To elect the 12 nominees named herein to the Board of Directors of Whole Foods Market, Inc., each to serve a term expiring at the later of the Annual Meeting of Shareholders in 2018 or upon a successor being elected and qualified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors unanimously recommends that you vote FOR each of the nominees to the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. To conduct an advisory vote to approve the compensation of the named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors unanimously recommends that you vote FOR approval of the compensation of the named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. To conduct an advisory vote on the frequency of shareholder advisory votes on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors unanimously recommends that you vote to conduct a shareholder advisory vote on executive compensation every ONE YEAR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4. To ratify the appointment of Ernst & Young LLP as independent auditor for the Company for the fiscal year ending September 24, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors unanimously recommends that you vote FOR ratification of Ernst & Young LLP as our independent auditor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder Proposals
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5. To ask that our Board of Directors adopt revisions to the Companys proxy access bylaw.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors unanimously recommends that you vote AGAINST this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6. To ask that our Board of Directors issue a report regarding our food waste efforts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors unanimously recommends that you vote AGAINST this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will also consider other business that properly comes before the meeting in accordance with Texas law and our Bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: How do I vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: You may vote your shares in advance using any of the following voting alternatives:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: VIA INTERNET at www.ProxyVote.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BY TELEPHONE by viewing the proxy materials at www.ProxyVote.com and using a touch-tone phone and the toll-free number provided at that time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can also use a telephone to request a paper copy of the proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: BY MAIL by completing and mailing in a paper proxy card, as outlined in the Notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Alternatively, you may vote your shares in person at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If, like most shareholders of the Company, you hold your shares in street name through a stockbroker, bank or other nominee rather than directly in your own name, you are considered the beneficial owner of those shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To vote at the meeting, beneficial owners will need to contact the broker, trustee or nominee that holds their shares to obtain a legal proxy to bring to the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are encouraged to read all of the proxy materials before voting your shares as they contain important information necessary to make an informed decision.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are registered directly in your name with our transfer agent, Securities Transfer Corporation, you are considered a shareholder of record with respect to those shares, and the Notice has been sent directly to you by Broadridge Financial Solutions, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are the beneficial owner of those shares, the Notice is being forwarded to you.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please carefully consider the information contained in this Proxy Statement and, whether or not you plan to attend the meeting, vote by Internet, telephone or mail so that we can be assured of having a quorum present at the meeting and so that your shares may be voted in accordance with your wishes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even if you plan on attending the meeting but later decide not to attend, your vote will be counted if you vote by Internet, telephone or mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We encourage you to register your vote via the Internet at www.ProxyVote.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you attend the meeting, you may also submit your vote in person, in which case any votes that you previously submitted (whether via the Internet, by telephone or by mail) will be superseded by the vote that you cast at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether your proxy is submitted by the Internet, by telephone or by mail, if it is properly completed and submitted and if you do not revoke it prior to the meeting, your shares will be voted at the meeting in the manner set forth in this Proxy Statement or as otherwise specified by you.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To vote at the meeting, beneficial owners will need to contact the broker, trustee or nominee that holds their shares to obtain a legal proxy to bring to the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless you hold your shares through the Companys 401(k) plan, you may vote via the Internet or by telephone until 11:59
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: p.m., Eastern Time, on February 16, 2017, or the Companys agent must receive your paper proxy card on or before February 16, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you participate in the Companys 401(k) plan, your proxy card includes shares that the plan has credited to your account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To allow sufficient time for the Companys 401(k) plan trustee to vote, the trustee must receive your voting instructions via Internet or by telephone by 11:59 p.m., Eastern Time, on February 14, 2017, or the Companys agent must receive your paper proxy card on or before February 14, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the trustee does not receive your
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: instructions by that date, the trustee will vote the shares in the same proportion of votes that the trustee receives from other plan participants who did vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: If I do provide voting instructions and/or grant my proxy, who will vote my shares at the meeting and how will they vote my shares?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: John Mackey and Glenda Flanagan are officers of the Company and were named by our Board of Directors as proxy holders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: They will vote all proxies, or record an abstention, in accordance with the directions on the proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If no contrary direction is given, the shares will be voted as recommended by the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: What happens if additional matters are presented at the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A:     Other than the items of business described in this Proxy Statement, we are unaware of any other business to be acted upon at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you grant a proxy, the persons named as proxy holders, John Mackey and Glenda Flanagan, will have the discretion to vote your shares on any additional matters properly presented for a vote at the meeting in accordance with Texas law and our Bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: If my shares are held in street name by my broker, will my broker vote my shares for me?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: Your broker is allowed to vote your shares only on certain routine proposals or if you provide your broker with instructions on how to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under applicable stock exchange rules, only Proposal 4 (ratification of the appointment of Ernst & Young LLP as independent auditors) is routine.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Brokers are prohibited from voting uninstructed shares on non-routine proposals, including proposals for elections of directors and all other proposals except Proposal 4.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you do not give your broker or nominee specific instructions, your shares may not be voted on certain matters and will not be considered as present and entitled to vote with respect to those matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: What constitutes a quorum?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Why is a quorum required?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: Return of your proxy is important because a quorum is required for the Company shareholders to conduct business at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The presence at the meeting, in person or by proxy, of the holders of shares having a majority of the voting power represented by all issued and outstanding shares entitled to vote on the record date will constitute a quorum, permitting us to conduct the business of the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxies received but marked as abstentions, if any, will be included in the calculation of the number of shares considered to be present at the meeting for quorum purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because this proxy includes a routine management proposal, shares represented by such broker non-votes will be counted in determining whether there is a quorum present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If we do not have a quorum, we will be forced to reconvene the Annual Meeting of Shareholders at a later date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: What if I abstain?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: Abstentions are included in the determination of shares present for quorum purposes; however, except as required by applicable law or regulations, votes submitted as abstentions will not be counted as votes FOR or AGAINST any matter presented for shareholder approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: Can I change my vote after I have delivered my proxy?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: Yes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may revoke your proxy at any time before its exercise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may also revoke your proxy by voting in person at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a beneficial shareholder, you must contact your brokerage firm or bank to change your vote or obtain a legal proxy to vote your shares if you wish to cast your vote in person at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: Who will count the votes?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: We hired Carl T. Hagberg and Associates to judge voting and be responsible for determining whether or not a quorum is present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We hired Broadridge Financial Solutions, Inc. to tabulate votes cast by proxy or in person at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: Where can I find voting results of the meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: We will announce preliminary general voting results at the meeting and publish final detailed voting results on a Current Report on Form 8-K that we expect to file within four business days after the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: Who will bear the cost for soliciting votes for the meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A:     We will bear all expenses in conjunction with the solicitation of the enclosed proxy, including the charges of brokerage houses and other custodians, nominees or fiduciaries for forwarding documents to security owners and the fee to Georgeson Inc., who will help us solicit proxies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We anticipate that the fee to Georgeson Inc. will be $8,500, plus expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, proxies may be solicited by mail, email, in person, or by telephone or fax by certain of our directors, officers and other team members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: Whom should I call with other questions?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: If you have additional questions about this Proxy Statement or the meeting or would like additional copies of this document or our 2016 Annual Report on Form 10-K, please contact: Whole Foods Market, 550 Bowie Street, Austin, TX 78703, Attention: Investor Relations Dept., Telephone: (512) 542-0204.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: How can I communicate with the Companys Board of Directors?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: Shareholders may send communications in care of the Director of Internal Audit, Whole Foods Market, 550 Bowie Street, Austin, TX 78703, or via email to: shareholder.communications@wholefoods.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please indicate whether your message is for the Board of Directors as a whole, a particular group or committee of directors, or an individual director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has implemented procedures for processing shareholder communications and a description of these procedures can be found on our website at http://investor.wholefoodsmarket.com/investors/corporate-governance/governance-documents/default.aspx.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Web links throughout this document are provided for convenience only, and the content on the referenced websites does not constitute a part of this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 1  ELECTION OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Size of Board of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors currently consists of 12 members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All 12 members of the Board of Directors are elected by the holders of our common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board of Directors Recommendation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS RECOMMENDS THAT YOU VOTE FOR EACH OF THE NOMINEES TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS SET FORTH IN THIS PROPOSAL 1.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vote Required
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Election of each director requires the affirmative vote of a majority of the votes cast by the holders of shares represented at the meeting and entitled to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Current Nominees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The director nominees are Dr. John Elstrott, Mary Ellen Coe, Shahid (Hass) Hassan, Stephanie Kugelman, John Mackey, Walter Robb, Jonathan Seiffer, Morris (Mo) Siegel, Jonathan Sokoloff, Dr. Ralph Sorenson, Gabrielle Sulzberger and William (Kip) Tindell, III.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the nominees is currently a member of the Board of Directors and each has been nominated for election at the Annual Meeting to hold office until the later of the next annual meeting or the election of his/her respective successor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our director nomination process is discussed below where we describe the purpose of our Nominating and Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors, upon the advice of the Nominating and Governance Committee, has determined that all of the director nominees, other than Mr. Mackey and Mr. Robb, are independent directors as defined in Rule 5605 of the NASDAQ Listing Rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This independence question is analyzed annually in both fact and appearance to promote arms-length oversight.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors considered the following information in determining whether or not our directors are independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Mackey is a current Company officer and the Company announced that Mr. Robb will resign as an
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: officer effective December 31, 2016, and accordingly the Board of Directors has concluded that neither is currently an independent director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to our other directors, some serve on the boards of or have an ownership interest in privately held companies, including some companies that are vendors of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Several of these directors have been entrepreneurs in the organic foods industry for a number of years and our Board of Directors believes that their industry experience is valuable to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As reported to us by our directors, in many cases the ownership interest of any board member in a vendor amounted to less than 2% of the vendors outstanding ownership interests, and in all cases amounted to less than 5% of the vendors outstanding ownership interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Collectively, the Companys purchases of product from all vendors in which any of our directors noted a fiscal year 2016 ownership interest and/or noted service as a director represented approximately 2.2% of the Companys purchases during fiscal year 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Furthermore, Jonathan Seiffer and Jonathan Sokoloff are both partners of Leonard Green & Partners, L.P., which is an affiliate of Beacon Holding Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2011, Beacon Holding Inc. purchased BJs Wholesale Club, Inc., which is a leading warehouse club operator in the eastern United States.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Messrs. Seiffer and Sokoloff are each a director of BJs Wholesale Club, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further discussion concerning director independence is in our Corporate Governance Principles, Board of Directors Mission Statement & Role Definition, which is available on our website at: http://investor.wholefoodsmarket.com/investors/corporate- governance/governance-documents/default.aspx.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The information provided below is biographical information about each of the nominees, including other public company board memberships.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Age and other information in each nominees biography are as of November 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. John Elstrott, 68, has served as the Chairman of the Board since 2009 and has served as a director of the Company since 1995, serving as Lead Director from 2001 to 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Elstrott is an Emeritus Professor of Entrepreneurship and the founding director of the Levy-Rosenblum Institute for Entrepreneurship at Tulane Universitys Freeman School of Business, which he started in 1991.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have long supported strong corporate governance practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors continually reviews our practices and ensures that they evolve to appropriately balance the interests of our stakeholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Set forth below are examples of practices that demonstrate this commitment to our stakeholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Practice      Explanation Director Independence We have an independent Chairman of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 10 of 12 director nominees are independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All committee members are independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independent directors regularly meet in executive sessions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Succession and Development In December 2016, our Board of Directors adopted a Board Succession and Development Plan, which is described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Practices of our Board of Directors and Committees Our directors conduct annual self-evaluations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of our Audit Committee members are audit committee financial experts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a diversity policy that our Nominating and Governance Committee considers in selecting and recommending candidates for election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: None of our directors serve on more than four public company boards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a director stock ownership policy in place that generally requires our non- management directors to meet a share ownership level with a value equal to or exceeding three times the cash compensation received for service on the Board of Directors for the prior fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See the Director Compensation Program for Fiscal Year 2016 section below for a description of the policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder Rights Directors are elected annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors must be elected by a majority vote standard in uncontested elections.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An incumbent director who is not re-elected must promptly offer to resign.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our bylaws contain simple majority vote requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our proxy access bylaw provides that a single shareholder or groups of up to 20 shareholders collectively owning at least 3% of our relevant voting power for at least three continuous years can include nominees in our proxy statement, up to a total number of such nominees not to exceed 20% of the number of directors then serving, subject to the eligibility, procedural and disclosure requirements set forth in the bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder Outreach We have a strong shareholder engagement program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We engage with our shareholders to ensure that both management and the board are made aware of issues that matter most to our investors so that these issues are addressed on a timely basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We engage regularly with our largest shareholders to hear their views on both general and company specific governance matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation See the Summary of Compensation Practices for Fiscal Year 2016 section of this Proxy Statement for a discussion of our leading compensation practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Committees and Meetings
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Committees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors maintains the following three standing committees: the Audit Committee, the Compensation Committee and the Nominating and Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The current members of the various committees are identified in the preceding table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The charter of each committee can be found in the Corporate Governance section of our website at http://investor.wholefoodsmarket.com/investors/corporate-governance/governance-documents/default.aspx.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The duties of each committee are set forth in its charter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of the Audit Committee is to assist the Board of Directors in fulfilling its responsibility for monitoring risks and the Companys internal control system, overseeing the quality and integrity of the accounting, auditing and reporting practices of the Company and the audits of the Companys financial statements, and other such duties as directed by the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee is expected to maintain free and open communication with the independent auditors, the Director of Internal Audit and the management of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In discharging this oversight role, the Committee is empowered to investigate any matter brought to its attention, with full power to retain outside counsel or other experts for this purpose.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committees responsibilities include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) selecting, hiring and evaluating our independent auditor;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) reviewing and discussing the adequacy and effectiveness of the Companys internal control over financial reporting;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) overseeing the integrity of our financial statements and monitoring our compliance with legal and regulatory requirements as they relate to financial statements or accounting matters;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) overseeing internal auditing processes;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) reviewing with management our audited financial statements, earnings announcements, regulatory filings and other public announcements regarding our results of operations;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) inquiring about significant risks, reviewing our risk assessment and management policies, and assessing steps taken to control these risks;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vii) establishing procedures for receipt, retention and treatment of complaints regarding accounting, internal accounting controls and auditing matters; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (viii) overseeing and reviewing the Companys internal audit function.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has determined that all Audit Committee members are audit committee financial experts under the regulations promulgated by the Securities and Exchange Commission.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has also determined that each of the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: directors serving on our Audit Committee is independent within the meaning of the applicable rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission and the NASDAQ Listing Rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of the Compensation Committee is to assist the Board of Directors in carrying out its responsibilities with respect to overseeing the Companys compensation policies and practices, review and approve annual compensation and compensation procedures for the Companys executive officers, and oversee and recommend director compensation to the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committees responsibilities include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) overseeing the Companys overall compensation structure, policies and programs, and assessing whether the Companys compensation structure establishes appropriate incentives for management and employees;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) making recommendations to the Board of Directors with respect to, and administering, the Companys incentive compensation and equity-based compensation plans, including the Companys stock option plan and team member stock purchase plan;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) reviewing and approving compensation procedures for the Companys executive officers;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) recommending to the independent directors for approval the compensation of the Co-Chief Executive Officers based on relevant corporate goals and objectives and the Board of Directors performance evaluation of the Co-Chief Executive Officers;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) reviewing and approving the compensation of executive officers other than the Co-Chief Executive Officers;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) reviewing and recommending to the Board of Directors employment and retention agreements and severance arrangements for executive officers, including change-in-control provisions, plans or agreements;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vii) annually reviewing the compensation of directors for service on the Board of Directors and its committees and recommending changes in compensation to the Board of Directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (viii) monitoring directors compliance with the Companys stock ownership guidelines;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ix) at least annually, reviewing and assessing the adequacy of the charter and participating in an evaluation of the committee;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (x) and working with Company management to address any conflict of interest with any compensation adviser engaged by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee Charter does not provide for any delegation of these duties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Regarding most compensation matters, including executive and director compensation, the Companys executive team provides recommendations to the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has determined that each of the directors serving on our Compensation Committee is independent within the meaning of the applicable rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission and the NASDAQ Listing Rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Neither the Compensation Committee nor Company management engaged any outside consultants regarding fiscal year 2016 executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nominating and Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Governance Committees purpose is to monitor and oversee matters of corporate governance, including the evaluation of the Board of Directors performance and processes and the independence of directors, and select, evaluate and recommend to the Board of Directors qualified candidates for election or appointment to the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Governance Committee identifies director candidates through recommendations made by members of the Board of Directors, management, shareholders and others, including the possibility of a search firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At a minimum, a Board of Directors nominee should have significant management or leadership experience which is relevant to the Companys business, as well as personal and professional integrity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors believes it is in the best interest of the Company and its shareholders to identify and select highly qualified candidates to serve as directors and for the Board of Directors to be comprised of a diverse group of individuals with different backgrounds and perspectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommendations are developed based on the nominees knowledge and experience in a variety of fields, and research conducted by the Companys staff at the Nominating and Governance Committees direction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: More details about the committees process for identifying and recommending board candidates is discussed below under the heading Board Succession and Development.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any shareholder recommendation should be directed to the attention of the Company Secretary and should include the candidates name, home and business contact information, detailed biographical data, relevant qualifications for Board of Directors membership, information regarding any relationships between the candidate and the Company within the last three years, and a written indication by the recommended candidate of his or her willingness to serve.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining whether to nominate a candidate, whether from an internally generated or shareholder recommendation, the Nominating and Governance Committee will consider the current composition and capabilities of serving board members, as well as additional capabilities considered necessary or desirable in light of existing and future Company needs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Governance Committee also exercises its independent business judgment and discretion in evaluating the suitability of any recommended candidate for nomination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fiscal year 2016, the Nominating and Governance Committee and the Board of Directors used the services of a third party search firm to assist in evaluating and identifying director candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has determined that each of the directors serving on our Nominating and Governance Committee is independent within the meaning of the applicable NASDAQ Listing Rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fiscal Year 2016 Meetings
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal year 2016, the Board of Directors and the various committees held the following number of meetings: Board of Directors, six meetings; Audit Committee, nine meetings; Compensation Committee, two meetings; and Nominating and Governance Committee, four meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other than Mr. Sokoloff, no director attended fewer than 75% of the meetings of the Board of Directors (and any committees thereof) that he or she was required to attend.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is a policy of the Board of Directors to encourage directors to attend each Annual Meeting of Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All members of the Board of Directors attended the Companys 2016 Annual Meeting of Shareholders, other than Ms. Coe, who was not yet a director on that date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Succession and Development
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In December 2016, the Board of Directors implemented a Board Succession and Development Plan to strengthen the Board of Directors ability to further the best long-term interests of the Companys shareholders and other stakeholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recognizes that the Company is a uniquely mission-driven company, driven by the Companys Core Values and focused on achieving sustainable profits and maximizing long-term shareholder value while creating value for all of the Companys major stakeholders, each of whom are interdependently linked.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors quality, culture and dedication have been important factors to the Companys success, and the Board of Directors recognizes the importance of good governance in relation to board succession and development planning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The key principles underlying the Board Succession and Development Plan include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: continuing to review periodically the Board of Directors own composition to ensure it reflects the knowledge, experience, skills and diversity that will best enable the Board of Directors to fulfill its duties and looking ahead and considering both current and future needs of the Company, especially as the Companys strategies, initiatives and business conditions change over time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The results of the Board of Directors and its committees regular self-evaluation practices will continue to be incorporated into director succession and nomination decisions;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: seeking to achieve a variety of backgrounds, ages, tenures and experiences within the boardroom to help ensure robust oversight, board quality, stability and continuity of experience while infusing new insights and perspectives into Board discussions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A balanced Board of Directors will also enable the strong mentoring and development that has been infused into the management of the Company to also occur at the board level, with more seasoned and experienced members of the Board of Directors offering insight and guidance to newer members and newer members sharing their perspectives with longer-tenured directors as well;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: having a strong pipeline of candidates to consider from time to time for membership on the Board of Directors, using the criteria determined by the Board of Directors and the Nominating and Governance Committee as reflected in the Corporate Governance Principles and the charter of the Nominating and Governance Committee, to facilitate an orderly identification and selection of new directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: in determining whether to nominate any individual director for re-election, the Board of Directors will annually review and evaluate the on-going contribution of such director to the overall effectiveness of the Board of Directors as a whole;  seeking to bring the average tenure of the Board of Directors more in line with peer practices over the next three to five years through a combination of adding new directors and anticipated director retirements;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: through a combination of adding new directors and anticipated director retirements;  following two objective mechanisms to facilitate the goals of the Board Succession and Development Plan, specifically that, beginning with the 2018 annual meeting, (1) for all independent directors whose terms began in 2008 or after, and who join the Board of Directors in the future, such directors will not stand for re-election after 15 years of service and (2) for other independent directors, such directors will not stand for re-election after 15 years of service or after reaching the age of 72, whichever occurs later;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: if a directors principal occupation or business association changes substantially during the directors tenure on the Board of Directors, the director will be expected to promptly notify the Nominating and Governance Committee, following which the committee will evaluate the propriety of continued service on the Board of Directors and make a recommendation to the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: of Directors what action, if any, should be taken;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: prioritizing strong director onboarding as well as on-going director education and tutorials to accelerate the ability of newly added directors to get up to speed and contribute quickly while also ensuring that continuing directors stay apprised of current developments and contribute effectively on an on-going basis; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the Board of Directors and the Nominating and Governance Committee will continue to regularly review the Board Succession and Development Plan, assess whether changes or updates are needed and evaluate progress against the plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The rotation in December 2016 of the chairmanships of the Companys key committees, including the Audit Committee, the Compensation Committee, and the Nominating and Governance Committee, such that all committees have new leadership, also reflects the Companys commitment to ensuring the practices of the Board of Directors continue to evolve and benefit from fresh perspectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Committee memberships have also been updated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, reflecting the implementation of the Board Succession and Development Plan, incumbent director Dr. Ralph Sorenson will not stand for re-election at the 2018 annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 addition to the Board of Directors of independent director Mary Ellen Coe is reflective of the principles underlying the Board Succession and Development Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An executive at Google, Ms. Coes deep experience in marketing, digital strategy, and brand strategy is valuable to the Board of Directors and her leadership, expertise and understanding of evolving marketplaces is already enhancing board deliberations and oversight as the Company remains focused on strategic investments in marketing and elevating the digital experience to create shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Coe is also the third woman member of our Board of Directors, and her appointment followed a robust and extensive director search process aligned with the Board of Directors self-evaluation process, featuring the use of a nationally recognized, third-party director search firm and adherence to the commitments made in the Corporate Governance Principles and Nominating and Governance Committee Charter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These commitments included prioritizing experience relevant to the Companys strategy and business, ensuring that candidates with a diversity of ethnicity and gender are included in each pool of candidates from which Board of Directors nominees are chosen and including potential candidates from varied backgrounds, including going beyond the traditional former CEO corporate background as a required criteria for new candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company will continue to evaluate board composition and opportunities to strengthen the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Oversight of Enterprise Risk
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk management is primarily the responsibility of the Companys management team.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, our Board of Directors oversees the management teams assessment of the material risks faced by the Company at both the full Board of Directors level and at the committee level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with our Audit Committee charter, the Audit Committee is responsible for assisting the Board of Directors in fulfilling its responsibility for monitoring Company risk and the Companys internal control system and for assisting the Board of Directors in fulfilling its responsibility for oversight of the quality and integrity of the accounting, auditing and reporting practices of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To assist the Audit Committee in assessing the Companys approach to risk management, the management team prepares a list of what it perceives to be the most significant risks facing the Company, along with a statement reflecting any associated action the Company is taking to mitigate each type of risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee reports on risk to the full Board of Directors as necessary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, each quarterly board report from management addresses matters of particular importance or concern including any significant areas of risk that require Board of Directors and/or committee attention.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Throughout the year the Board of Directors and committees receive a variety of management presentations on different business topics that include discussion of associated significant risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk Considerations in our Compensation Programs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of our regular review of compensation practices, management conducted a comprehensive review of our compensation policies and practices for all team members for fiscal year 2016 in order to determine whether risks arising from any of those policies and practices are reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Managements conclusion was presented to and discussed with the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In its review, management analyzed each of our compensation policies and practices, including any potential risks arising from the policies and practices and factors that mitigate risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on its review, management concluded that the Company does not have compensation policies or practices that create risks that are reasonably likely to have a material effect on the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Factors that management believes mitigate risks include the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a food retailer, we are not engaged in activities that present a high risk related to our team member compensation relative to other businesses;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executives compensation mix of base salary and short-term and long-term incentives provides compensation opportunities
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: measured by a variety of time horizons to balance our short-term and long-term strategic goals;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our incentive bonus payouts are effectively capped due to our salary cap;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our bonuses for our executive officers and the rest of our leadership network employ a reasonable mix of performance metrics and are not concentrated on a single metric;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Criteria for payments to our executive officers and the rest of our leadership network under our annual bonus are closely aligned with our strategic goals and shareholder interests;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payout curves are reasonable and do not contain steep cliffs that might encourage unreasonable short-term business decisions to achieve payment thresholds;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For our executive officers and the rest of our leadership network, a significant portion of variable pay is delivered through long- term incentives which carry vesting schedules over multiple years;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity awards for team members are subject to service-based vesting schedules over multiple years;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Code of Business Conduct, our internal controls and other measures implemented by us help
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a policy against hedging and pledging arrangements by Section 16 officers entered into after January 24, 2013
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Leadership Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The roles of Chairman of the Board of Directors and Chief Executive Officer are currently separated at the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors believes that the right leadership structure for the board should be determined from time to time by the needs and circumstances of the Company, including taking into account the dynamic and evolving landscape in which the Company operates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors believes the current separation of the roles is appropriate at this time, including because it enables the Chief Executive Officer to focus on strategic leadership, execution and day-to-day management of our business, while the Chairman focuses on board-level leadership and facilitating the boards ability to be a strategic partner with management and provide oversight and monitoring.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors will continue to review the boards leadership structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal year 2016, none of our executive officers served as a member of the board of directors of any other company that had an executive officer serving as a member of our Board of Directors Compensation Committee.

sentences.text: Code of Business Conduct
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company expects all of its team members and directors to act in accordance with the highest standards of personal and professional integrity at all times, and to comply with the Companys policies and procedures and all laws, rules and regulations of any applicable international, federal, provincial, state or local government.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has adopted a Code of Business Conduct, which is posted on the Corporate Governance section of the Companys website at http:// investor.wholefoodsmarket.com/investors/corporate-governance/governance-documents/default.aspx.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Code of Business Conduct applies to the Companys principal executive officers, principal financial officer, principal accounting officer, controller and other persons who perform similar functions for the Company, in addition to the corporate directors and employees of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We strive to promote an ownership mentality among key leadership and our Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In December 2016, we amended our Corporate Governance Principles to provide that non-management members of the board are required to meet a share ownership level with a value equal to or exceeding three times the cash compensation received for service on the Board of Directors for the prior fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Share ownership is defined to include shares of the Companys common stock (including unvested restricted stock) and restricted stock units (whether vested or unvested) that the director directly or indirectly beneficially owns for purposes of Section 16 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors are expected to meet the stated ownership level within three years of joining the board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If for two consecutive years a director has not satisfied the ownership requirement amount by the compliance deadline, he or she must retain all shares acquired on the vesting of equity awards or the exercise of stock options (in all cases net of exercise costs and taxes) until compliance is achieved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compliance with this policy will be measured as of the first trading day of the fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based upon the directors share ownership levels at the time that this policy was adopted, all directors would have been in compliance on September 26, 2016, which was the first day of fiscal year 2017, other than Ms. Coe, who was not yet a director on that date.
